lexUnit.name: midnight.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: twelve o'clock at night; the middle of the night

sentence.text: By midnight on January 21st no leads had been uncovered .
The flights must be booked between today and midnight on New Year 's Day and tickets remain valid until the end of March .
Firemen were called to Old Cemetery Road in Hartlepool shortly before midnight on Tuesday to put out a blazing car .
At half-past eleven the house was so quiet they decided not to wait until midnight .
Midnight on 31 December 1992 will see the completion of the Single European Market .
We 'll often meet around midnight , taking in a beverage or two at Highway and the Garage , and tripping the light fantastic ( and the fantastic lights ) at Krypton and Cosmos .
She went out and returned around midnight .
This screening came at about midnight , after a traditional Elizabethan dinner and free drinks , with an 8.30am departure due the following day .
Germany will be reunited tonight ; the ceremony takes place at midnight when Berlin will become the capital of an independent Germany .
I 'll wait there till midnight .
A tireless organizer , he travelled over 100,000 miles within England and when in Birmingham reached his office before 6 a.m. and worked till midnight .
It was after midnight by the time he was able to continue his journey .
It was around midnight and the staff were lively and efficient .
The bar was full , it was a few minutes after midnight , the crowd was smart and broken up into self-consumed groups , and yet Mark looked up , as did several others .
` We 're going home at midnight tomorrow . "
When it had gone midnight Lowell knew she was n't coming .
With the unification process underway ( it happened at midnight on 2nd October , 1990 ) , the anniversary of the European war 's end had special significance in Germany .
Tina got drunk and remembered very little of what happened after midnight .
` The police seem to think it happened some time after midnight last night . "
` Next train to Garvie leaves at midnight , does n't it ? "
He said Tania , 28 , was in ` a very distressed state " when she left the matrimonial home around midnight .
The next thing Shiona did was phone Glasgow Central Station and book two sleepers on the overnight train that left just before midnight .
Midnight passes and another sleepless night begins .
Under the terms of Knighton 's original contract with Edwards , he set midnight tomorrow as the deadline for posting a formal offer to shareholders .
Departing staff will be required to clear their desks and hand in their entry passes by midnight tonight .
Anyone who takes part must register as soon as he or she has completed 15 minutes ' exercise , between midnight tonight and 10.30pm tomorrow .
